meanings.definition: Surrounded or closed off on all sides.
meanings.sent1: The cat felt safe in the enclosed space.
meanings.sent2: The enclosed garden was a peaceful retreat.
meanings.sent3: The enclosed picnic basket kept the ants away.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was like an enclosed garden, hidden from prying eyes.
meanings.sent5: The enclosed fort was a fortress of solitude.

meanings.sent1: The enclosed gift came with a lovely card.
meanings.sent2: The enclosed documents were important for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The enclosed bonus surprised the employees.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an enclosed treasure, shared only with a select few.
meanings.sent5: The enclosed note added a personal touch to the package.

meanings.sent1: She enclosed the letter in the envelope.
meanings.sent2: The box enclosed a special gift.
meanings.sent3: He enclosed his excitement, waiting for the surprise.
meanings.sent4: The memories enclosed in her heart were precious.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the hug enclosed her in a sense of security.
